ircutils.ctcp¶

This module has various utilities for managing the CTCP protocol. It is is responsible for parsing CTCP data and making data ready to be sent via CTCP.

dequote(text)¶

Performs the opposite of quote() as it will essentially strip the quote character.

extract(message)¶

Splits a message between the actual message and any CTCP requests. It returns a 2-part tuple of (message, ctcp_requests) where ctcp_requests is a list of requests.

low_level_dequote(text)¶

Performs the complete opposite of low_level_quote as it converts the quoted character back to their original forms.

low_level_quote(text)¶

Performs a low-level quoting in order to escape characters that could otherwise not be represented in the typical IRC protocol.

quote(text)¶

This is CTCP-level quoting. It’s only purpose is to quote out \x01 characters so they can be represented INSIDE tagged CTCP data.

tag(message)¶

Wraps an X-DELIM (\x01) around a message to indicate that it needs to be CTCP tagged.
